channel.title: If You Were To Be In Charge Of Your Own Auxy SoundPack
channel.description:
If you were to be in charge of your own Auxy soundpack, what would you include?
Thanks @anechoik for the idea. :wink:

item.title: If You Were To Be In Charge Of Your Own Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: Altezza_Music
item.description:
I’d ask Porter Robinson or Madeon to make a soundpack or make a soundpack that sounds like them. I’d even make a vocal chop soundpack, but I don’t know how.

item.title: If You Were To Be In Charge Of Your Own Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: TAURUS
item.description:
1. The voice sound that Deorro uses

  2. The sound KSHMR used in Burn

  3. Chord plucks by Deorro

  4. Chords

  5. A pan effect riser

  6. That one bass that goes in between kicks

  7. A base similar to punch that can give your kicks more bass

  8. A random KSHMR synth

  9. A KSHMR vocal

  10. Two sick drum packs!

Read full topic

item.title: If You Were To Be In Charge Of Your Own Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: blackocean
item.description:
EZ
2 pad synths - saws with pink noise
2 808 kicks (like punch with more OOF)
2 pluck synths (bright and tingy)
foley drum kit
a bunch of Growls and “WoopWoops” to assist in hybrid trap production
yeah p much it
oh also the DJ snake “eouh eouh eouh” vocal chop

Read full topic

item.title: If You Were To Be In Charge Of Your Own Auxy SoundPack
item.dc:creator: RazerFireRiot
item.description:
My AP pack will not be focused on a certain type of sound, in fact, a variety of sounds and synths!
I’d would most likely call it “Ajacent Wonders”

Well… mainly effects

Effects:
“Skyline”: A sound effect based on the night time sounds from the birds eye view of New York, like that wind, traffic, police sirens, try imagining it to understand what I mean.

“Crowd”: An audience sound effect! How does that sound? Give the listener and fans the feeling like you’re performing at a concert in your own little music production room.

“Software”: Basically using all the sounds in iOS in one “drum kit”.

“Blast”: An airhorn, basically.

Drum kit:

“Bit”: An 8 bit based drum kit, bringing the retro to the future of music making.

Synths:
“Float”: That calming yet amazing synth that you would hear in a lot of Future Bass songs, for example, Virtual Riot - Stay for a While.

“Chips”: That square synth we all heard back in the day, ahh the golden age of games… Now imagine using it in your own Auxy track!

Bass:
“Ripple”: A bass that was meant to be with the innovative Automation, meant to be used for your wubby wubs you’ve imagined.

Read full topic
item.source: If You Were To Be In Charge Of Your Own Auxy SoundPack
